perturbation.original_text: Licensor grants to Rogers the non-exclusive license and right to distribute and exhibit in Canada (the "Territory") all entertainment programming to which Licensor owns or controls the VOD distribution and exhibition rights in the Territory (collectively, "Licensed Programs") to residential subscribers of Rogers' digital cable television service on a Video-on-Demand ("VOD") basis.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensor grants to Rogers the non-exclusive license and right to distribute and exhibit in Canada (the "Territory") all entertainment programming to which Licensor owns or controls the VOD distribution and exhibition rights in the Territory (collectively, "Licensed Programs") to residential subscribers of Rogers' digital cable television service on a Video-on-Demand ("VOD") basis. Rogers may only exhibit licensed programs that licensor has provided written consent for exhibition.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts the initial grant of rights by adding a requirement for written consent for each exhibited program. This creates uncertainty about Rogers' ability to distribute licensed programs without prior licensor approval, conflicting with the original non-exclusive license.

perturbation.original_text: During the Term, Rogers shall have the non-exclusive right to distribute and exhibit each Licensed Program on a VOD basis for a period of ninety (90) consecutive days, or such longer period as may be agreed to by Rogers and Licensor (the "License Period").
perturbation.changed_text: During the Term, Rogers shall have the non-exclusive right to distribute and exhibit each Licensed Program on a VOD basis for a period of ninety (90) consecutive days, or such longer period as may be agreed to by Rogers and Licensor (the "License Period"). Notwithstanding, Rogers may only exhibit each Licensed Program on a VOD basis for a period of sixty (60) consecutive days.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts the original License Period. The original text allows for a 90-day period or longer if agreed upon. The added sentence reduces this to a maximum of 60 days regardless of any prior agreement, creating confusion over the allowable distribution period.

perturbation.original_text: Rogers shall pay to Licensor a fee (the "License Fee"), which shall be equal to fifty (50)% of Retail Revenues.
perturbation.changed_text: Rogers shall pay to Licensor a fee (the "License Fee"), which shall be equal to fifty (50)% of Retail Revenues. Rogers may, at its sole discretion, adjust the license fee up to 25% based on consumer demand.
perturbation.explanation: This change adds a discretionary element to the License Fee, contradicting the original fixed percentage. By allowing Rogers to adjust the fee based on 'consumer demand,' it creates ambiguity and uncertainty about the actual amount Licensor will receive, conflicting with the initial agreement of 50% of Retail Revenues.
